intro: Amsinckia pratensis, commonly known as the meadow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive globular shape. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Amsinckia pratensis is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
